thread.title: Price named first star of the week
thread.title_full: Price named first star of the week | Examiner.com

author: Rudy Martinez
title: Price named first star of the week
text:
Play Carey Price stopping Rick Nash source: youtube Montreal Canadiens goaltender Carey Price is honored for the first time in the second week of NHL action as he takes the first star of the week along with Tyler Seguin of the Dallas Stars and Vladimir Tarasenko of the St Louis Blues.
Price has been nothing short of perfect since winning his third game while his team completed winning five in a row that set a new franchise record in their 106-year history. The 28-year-old rom Anahim Lake, British Columbia has a 1.00 GAA and a .963 save percentage including his shutout over the New York Rangers Oct.15. It was his 35th career shutout and a great way to start another season of possibly becoming a back-to-back MVP in the league.
His 31 saves against the Pittsburgh Penguins helped his team use their offense to beat them 3-2 for their fourth victory of the season. After taking care of the Rangers on opening night at Centre Bell, the Habs went on to tame the Detroit Red Wings 4-1 to end their week with three wins.
Last season, Price had such a strong season that he was awarded the Hart, Vezina, William M. Jennings Trophies as well as the Ted Lindsay award. While this is the first time the league has given him honors this season, it wont be the last as we have seen just the beginning of what Price can do in the net.
